body.para: Ok. I have getSessionAttributeNames method from XSPRequestHelper wich returns a Vector. This method uses getAttributeNames from Session, wich returns an enumeration. What should this method (getSessionAttributeNames) return ? The same enumeration ? As right now, it creates a Vector, copies the contents and returns the vector. Should it do the same with a List or is it better to return the enumeration ?

quote.quotepara: -----Mensaje original----- De: giacomo [mailto:giacomo@apache.org] Enviado el: Jueves, 24 de Mayo de 2001 06:18 a.m. Para: cocoon-dev@xml.apache.org Asunto: Re: [Patch] Session

Sorry, Pablo, that I wasn't able to apply your patch so far. As you've talked about Vectors (which should be deprecated in favor of the new Collection classes) we need to move them to a List. It would be very appreciated If you can supply a patch for that, too.
On Wed, 23 May 2001, Pablo Bendersky wrote:
I'm resending this mail because I see you are planning to go beta, and I find this patch useful and think the session:get-variable-names is a very useful option.

Hi. I've found a little problem when using <session:get-variable-names/> from the session taglib. The first error I found was with the use of the Java Vector in that xsl file. To make it work, I also have to import java.util.Vector in xsp.xsl.
There was an error also in XSPRequestHelper.java, in the method getSessionAttributeNames, because it returned a vector with the attribute values instead of the attribute names. I modified it also.

I'm sending you the patch. I wasn't able to run cvs diff (sorry for this), so I've run diff -c in each modified file and sending you a .tar.gz file including the .diff and the new file (with the directory structure).
